value.title: Bipartisan Policy Center And Ethics Policy For Artificial Intelligence: Inside The Beltway Thinking Is Still An Issue
value.excerpt: I am rarely impressed by Inside the Beltway thinking. My recent reading of “Turning Point” is an exception that proves the rule. For the second time this month, I came upon a discussion of governmental policy for AI,

value.title: Samsung's new washing machine will use AI to take the guesswork out of laundry
value.excerpt: Samsung's latest washing machine aims to take the confusion out of doing your laundry. According to the company, its WW9800T washer relies on artificial intelligence to automatically choose the correct cycle settings for the task at hand.

value.title: Microsoft researcher Dr. Cecily Morrison will discuss keeping AI “personal” at Sight Tech Global
value.excerpt: For Dr. Cecily Morrison, research into how AI can help people who are blind or visually disabled is deeply personal. It’s not only that the Microsoft Principal Researcher has a 7-year-old son who is blind,

value.title: Why Banks Need To Sharpen Their Focus On Financial Crime
value.excerpt: As banks contend with the economic fallout from the Covid-19 pandemic, their ability to respond to financial crime threats is not keeping pace with the sophistication and sheer number of incoming attacks.

value.title: Robotaxi Startup Voyage Loads Self-Driving Vans With Coronavirus-Killing Tech
value.excerpt: The self-driving company that provides ride services for senior citizens is outfitting autonomous minivans with an ultraviolet lighting system adapted from ambulances.

value.title: AI Will Revolutionize Healthcare. The Transformation Has Already Begun.

value.title: YouTube removes record number of videos after increasing role of AI in content review
value.excerpt: YouTube says it took down a record number of videos in the second quarter of this year due to an increased use of AI in its content review efforts.

value.title: Volkswagen to test autonomous vehicles in Chinese city Hefei
value.excerpt: Volkswagen AG said on Wednesday it will start testing autonomous vehicles in China's eastern city of Hefei, its first in the world's biggest car market.

value.title: Tour de France 2020 to feature augmented reality, machine learning, and more
value.excerpt: The historic Tour de France kicks off this weekend. This year's race will include a host of technology solutions to boost fan engagement amid the coronavirus pandemic.

value.title: DDN Recognized for Innovation in Artificial Intelligence Data Management with 2020 AI Breakthrough Award

value.title: Pony.ai inks robo-taxi fleet maintenance partnership with Bosch
value.excerpt: Self-driving car startup Pony.ai announced Bosch as a vehicle fleet maintenance partner. The two launched a pilot in San Francisco earlier this year.

value.title: Coronation: See the haunting trailer for Ai Weiwei's movie about China's lockdown
value.excerpt: The Chinese artist and activist directed and produced the documentary from Europe, with ordinary citizens in Wuhan providing footage. It's streaming now.

value.title: Elon Musk’s Neuralink to unveil V2 brain implant machine in Aug 28 event
value.excerpt: As anticipation builds for Neuralink’s upcoming livestream on August 28, Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk provided yet another exciting update for the event. According to Musk, the brain-machine interface startup will not only show a working Neuralink device on Friday;

value.title: 3 strategies for enterprise AI success
value.excerpt: Especially during turbulent times, AI enables companies to draw customers closer, streamline to reduce costs, and become more agile than competitors.

value.title: Six Things Business Owners Should Know About AI
value.excerpt: AI was first developed in the 1950s. Nowadays, 37% of the organizations surveyed by Gartner are using some form of AI. They're using it to automate processes, find lucrative opportunities and detect threats before humans can.

value.title: Baidu Is Searching For Quantum AI Advantage
value.excerpt: Baidu, China’s leading search engine and AI powerhouse, recently announced Paddle Quantum, a quantum machine learning development toolkit. This was the latest in a series of steps Baidu has taken to marry quantum computing with AI since establishing its Institute for Quantum Computing in 2018.

value.title: Vector Institute forms team to help commercialize AI research
value.excerpt: The Vector Institute announced the creation of a new team dedicated to laying the groundwork for the commercialization of AI research.

value.title: Drug development in a year? IBM bets on AI, robotics to ramp up molecule research
value.excerpt: IBM’s new platform could contribute to ongoing research efforts at a time when discovering new drugs is at the heart of many projects.

value.title: China Still Buying $300 Billion of Chips From U.S., Elsewhere
value.excerpt: China will import $300 billion of semiconductors for the third straight year, underscoring how the world’s No. 2 economy remains tied to America despite billions invested in local chip-making know-how.

value.title: Coronavirus May Help Best Buy Become A Key Healthcare Player
value.excerpt: Best Buy reported a better-than-expected second-quarter profit as coronavirus led consumers to buy appliances, computers and fitness gear to better their remote working and learning experiences. But the pandemic may also hasten its transition to becoming a major healthcare-industry player.

value.title: Michael Kanaan: The U.S. needs an AI ‘Sputnik moment’ to compete with China and Russia
value.excerpt: Minus AI,” Kanaan calls attention to the need for the U.S. to wake up to AI as a matter of global power, in the same way that China and Russia have.

value.title: Microsoft Word To Take Voice Commands, Transcribe Recordings
value.excerpt: Microsoft said that updates to Office 365 will allow users to record conversations "directly in Word for the web and transcribe them automatically."

value.title: Researchers’ AI can perform 3D motion capture with any off-the-shelf camera
value.excerpt: In a paper, researchers at the Max Planck Institute and Facebook Reality Labs describe an AI-powered motion capture system that works with any camera.
